intro: Vania trinervia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, clustered in dense inflorescences. Vania trinervia is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in some areas.
